private_information: I monitor and reason about blocks A B C D E
I know the Blocks World rules: only the top block of a stack can be moved and only one block can be carried at a time
agent1.goal: Assist the orchestrator by reporting local state changes for blocks A B C D E after each relevant action so the orchestrator can compute the final arrangement.

private_information: I monitor and reason about blocks F G H I J
I know the Blocks World rules: only the top block of a stack can be moved and only one block can be carried at a time
agent2.goal: Assist the orchestrator by reporting local state changes for blocks F G H I J after each relevant action so the orchestrator can compute the final arrangement.

private_information: I must integrate local observations and the global action sequence to produce a final PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent observations and the full action trace to produce a correct PDDL domain and a PDDL problem describing the final blocks arrangement, suitable for solving with the FastDownwards planner.

init.rules: Standard Blocks World rules: only the top block of a stack can be moved and only one block can be carried at a time.

public_information: Blocks involved: A B C D E F G H I J.

Initial arrangement: A is on the table, B is on top of A, C is on top of B, D is on the table, E is on top of J, F is on the table, G is on top of H, H is on top of F, I is on top of D, J is on top of I.

The agents will execute the following action sequence in order: unstack(E, J) , stack(E, G) , unstack(C, B) , stack(C, B) , unstack(C, B) , stack(C, B) , unstack(C, B) , stack(C, B) , unstack(J, I) , stack(J, I) , unstack(E, G) , stack(E, C) , unstack(G, H) , putdown(G) , unstack(J, I) , stack(J, G) , unstack(H, F) , putdown(H) , unstack(I, D) , stack(I, H) , pickup(D) , stack(D, F) , unstack(J, G) , stack(J, I) , unstack(E, C) , stack(E, G) , unstack(J, I) , stack(J, D) , unstack(I, H) , stack(I, C) , pickup(H) , putdown(H) , unstack(I, C) , stack(I, J) , unstack(I, J) , putdown(I) , pickup(I) , putdown(I) , unstack(J, D) , stack(J, H) , pickup(I) , stack(I, C) , unstack(D, F) , stack(D, J) , unstack(D, J) , stack(D, E) , unstack(J, H) , stack(J, D) , pickup(H) , stack(H, J).
Task: Using the initial configuration and the action sequence, derive the final arrangement of the blocks and state for each block whether it is on the table or on top of another block.

observe.system_prompt: You are agent1, responsible for tracking and reporting the local state of blocks A B C D E. Do not emit PDDL. Provide a concise, ordered log of relevant state updates for these blocks following each action in the provided global action sequence. If an action does not affect your monitored blocks, note that it is unrelated.
observe.prompt: Your name is agent1. You are given the public information including the initial arrangement and the action sequence. Using your private information and the described actions, list the state changes that affect blocks A B C D E in order. For each relevant action, state which block moves from where to where and whether any block becomes clear or not clear as a result. Keep the report concise and factual.

observe.system_prompt: You are agent2, responsible for tracking and reporting the local state of blocks F G H I J. Do not emit PDDL. Provide a concise, ordered log of relevant state updates for these blocks following each action in the provided global action sequence. If an action does not affect your monitored blocks, note that it is unrelated.
observe.prompt: Your name is agent2. You are given the public information including the initial arrangement and the action sequence. Using your private information and the described actions, list the state changes that affect blocks F G H I J in order. For each relevant action, state which block moves from where to where and whether any block becomes clear or not clear as a result. Keep the report concise and factual.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling and in preparing planning problems for the FastDownwards planner. Your job is to integrate the local observations and the full action trace to produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that represent the final arrangement of blocks after the sequence. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file, keeping actions and predicates clear and suitable for FastDownwards. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Do not alter the semantics of Blocks World rules.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You receive the two agents' concise logs of state updates and the global action sequence from the environment. Integrate this information, resolve any naming or observation gaps, and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that describe the final state of the blocks after executing the full sequence. Target the FastDownwards solver and ensure the domain and problem are consistent with standard Blocks World operators. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.
